review:
If you are one of the people that have played this simulation for a number of years, then you will probably not want to download this again until the publishers/creators of this sim have updated it. I bought this sim years ago and was very pleased with it. I have not played it for a while and have this very day (02/02/2024) re-downloaded it in the hope that it has been updated with the now OPEN BLACKFRIARS station.  Such a nice looking station now by what I've seen on passing a year or two ago. However, I will play on, in the hope for an update on the opening of Blackfriars Station in this simulation. Fingers Crossed.
It still crashes on occasion too.

author: {'steamid': '76561199587541548', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 92, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1703967661}
review:
This game really does need an update considering how many bugs the game actually has. 

Even if you aren't going to add/remove anything from the game then the most you can do is actually fix the bugs so those who purchase and play the game has a much enjoyable experience as a whole.

I'd say that the game as a whole (except bugs) is actually really good and enjoyable, the only thing that I did not like was that you could not move left and/or right whenever you are In first/second person, the game randomly crashes (even though I have a really good PC) and finally, you don't loose or gain speed when going up or down hills. Besides all that, this game is actually enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996448343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1702919822}
review: terrible game, even worse simulator. The graphics are fine but ridden with bugs and simulation is appaling. Unrealistic. I can't even begin to explain how terrible this is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057448719', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1280, 'last_played': 1701167317}
review:
I had fun with this! it has a couple of issues stopping it being close to perfect but if you can get over them, it's still a fun little game to pass time. Graphics are nice. inertia feels correct. missions are well designed.

Here are the issues:

It's just one line. The circle line. Not the whole london underground.

The maps are unreadable. Especially inside the train. If you don't know the stations, you'll be struggling trying to read the blurry maps trying to understand where you're going.

Speed doesn't change going up or down hill. and there are some steep gradients. the game feels quite realistic but this pulls you right out of it when you're coasting up a hill without losing any speed

author: {'steamid': '76561198042315167', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 68, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1701110185}
review:
Game keeps crashing randomly. 
Tutorial mission cannot be completed due to a bug with driver's doors. 
Sounds are of a good quality, yet do not reflect the trains movement at all. 
The whole line is flat - no going uphill, no going downhill. Just flat. 
Speed signals make no sense - in some places there is five totally same of them closely packed together and in some places they are missing completely. 
Breaking the game is extremely easy - just run into a random wall and clip out of the world. 
Just by going into the rails you fall through the world. You can also accidentaly randomly accomplish this by entering the train.

author: {'steamid': '76561199201632862', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1696870073}
review: no esta mal del todo, no es muy bueno pero tampoco es malo, solo recomiendo este juego si te lo pillas muy rebajado de precio, dentro de lo que es world of subways y de las bazofias que hace aerosoft, este al menos no es malo del todo, yo me lo pillé por 5 euros en instant gaming y por ese precio me parece bueno, aunque me molesta que jugando ya 40min, se te crashee el juego, ademas de que no esta muy del todo bien optimizado, los controles manejando al conductor son muy toscos, los detalles gráficos y las sombras son muy mejorables, el juego en el aspecto de la iluminación se ve muy tétrico y apagado y la traducción al español es horrible, y los puntos fuertes son que el tren de conduce muy bien y es inmersivo, además de unos decentes sonidos ambientales, por 5 euros en instant gaming valen la pena, yo le doy un 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198357730715', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3496, 'last_played': 1683449353}
review:
Realistic train simulator set in the 2010-2011 period on the Circle Line.

WHAT WORKS WELL
Detailed stations
Realistic train
Beautiful scenery when out of a tunnel
WHAT DOESN'T
Timetable
Shift to use the controls? What is this?
No free explore mode
Typos everywhere
Extremely buggy

The cons outweigh the pros. If you're a hardcore WOS, LU, or Circle Line fan, you'll like it, but I don't. Disappointment for what could have been a greate game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137178682', 'num_games_owned': 740, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 874, 'last_played': 1667558445}
review:
A fantastic sim, it nails the sights, sounds and atmosphere of the London Underground. The C stock and the Circle Line are both beautifully recreated, this sim is a classic case of quality over quantity. The programmable announcements add to the immersion, and the signals and speed boards are all correctly placed, which means HUD-less driving is very doable, and is extremely enjoyable. The passenger AI is the best I have seen in a train sim, they are not static and will board, ride and depart the train without ever despawning or teleporting. They will also react to announcements, when you announce your departure, those still on the platform will run to the train before the doors close.

The game takes place at an interesting time on the London Underground, this game came out in 2011 (Steam says 2014 but that is when Aerosoft re-published it, not when it originally released) and at the time the Circle Line was still using the C stock and the District Line was still using the D stock (which feature in game as AI traffic), Hammersmith was being extended in anticipation of the S stock and the construction works are visible, and Blackfriers was closed for renovation (you actually have to remember to announce it's closed on the DVA every time you drive past). It's a fun snapshot, and feels a bit like a time machine, reminds me of the last time I was in London back in 2012, I spent that day riding the tube, haven't been back since then, but this game feels exactly like I remember it!

The scoring in the timetable mode can seem a bit strict, but I have managed to get 95% during a run, with the only deduction being for not keeping to the departure schedule. For those struggling with the game penalising them for "incorrect announcements" and/or "destination board set incorrectly" you only use the programmable announcements for the full Inner or Outer loop, if you are doing a shorter point to point run, you only use the manual announcements. There are a lot of destination boards to choose from, but only "Circle Line via Aldgate" is the correct one, you must have it set at both the front and back, and with the back light on. The other destination boards are just for immersions sake I guess, although you can still use them, but the game will deduct 5% of your score if you use a different one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995795277', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 82, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1645823487}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988204300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1645151146}
review:
This game experiences some crashes but you can solve it totally by downloading 4GB patch - find it on the internet. After patching I had no problems whatsoever.

The game is amazing. The graphics must have been great back in 2014 and it still is great today. We have the full Circle line with Hammersmith branch. There is a whole day timetable we can use. We will meet a lot of other trains and they will often held us on red light for a moment. The feel of the underground is amazing.

Every stations is modelled to real life and they look good. Judging by some modern products (Metropolitan and District lines for TS) the parts between stations are probably not looking as in real life but tha't not really a problem.

We have spoken announcements, we have passengers entering and exiting the train so we need to be careful when closing the doors. It's just amazing how well it works. The physics seems ok although the train brakes pretty good.

There are some functioning switches in the cab as for the cab and passenger lights, heating, ventilation. We need to setup both cabs before we go as we need to put on the tail lights in the second cab. At the end of the ride there is a summary.

Highly recommended. This game really gives us a feel of the underground and high traffic in the rush hours. I think this is the best of WOS series even better than WOS4 which is pretty good itself.

review:
Excelente, un juego realista, bonito, los trenes se conducen medianamente bien, esta bien ambientado.
Cosas Malas: Los sonidos de los trenes al frenar no son muy buenos, al igual que el de tracción no es muy realista, las estaciones no se pueden explorar, al poner en primera persona no puedes avanzar y el control de la persona es un poco tedioso pues solo se puede ir hacia adelante, botones que no sirven en el tablero. Pero yo recomiendo mucho este juego, ademas los requisitos son muy bajos para un juego de su talla, 9/10.

review: 7 years on and this game still delivers. The best WOS of the series. The programmers that wrote this went an extra mile and a half. It puts all other wos sims to shame. Train Sim World can't come close to this in my eyes. Never once froze on me, walking the platforms, getting on other trains, the sounds, the graphics. NOTHING comes close to driving a train than this. TSW shame on you, your effort (which I tried) comes no where close to this. I can't believe this game came out in 2014. It hasn't aged a bit. Just perfect programming and beautifully done.

author: {'steamid': '76561198290241474', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1703534949}
review:
The game's graphics hold up quite well to be honest, some textures (signage) aren't great and the Johnston font doesn't seem to be used, the NPC and character models are rather bad though which is a shame. The game runs rather well on my PC but increasing the passenger count causes some lag and I've experienced a crash just before I reached my destination. 

The game also slows down to an unplayable level after switching to another app and returning to the game and then eventually crashing. The game uses C Stock trains with pink handrails to represent Hammersmith & City Line trains even though every C Stock train after refurbishment always had yellow handrails.

Overall I'd give it a 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561199100002045', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1648518854}
review:
A very good sim. It is pretty realistic, graphics are ok though. Suggest to buy if you have a low end PC/laptop.

However, there are a few bugs that occur sometimes, for example you can't move in 1st person but you can in 3rd person. To fix this, i quit the game, then open again. If it still the same either do quit to main menu or quit the game multiple times until you can move in 1st person. Each time, I select the same route (and start again), as I find the glitch before starting the train.


FINAL RATING - 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1612700590}
review:
"World of Subways 3 – London Underground Circle Line" simuliert eine traditionsreiches U-Bahn-Linie in London.

Die Geschichte der Circle Line reicht weit zurück. Der Beschluss zur Ringstrecke stammt aus dem Jahre 1863, just in dem Jahre wurde die erste U-Bahn Strecke der Welt zwischen Paddington und Farringdon eröffnet, die auch Teil der Circle Line wurde. Es dauerte allerdings noch einige Jahre, nämlich bis 1884, bis der Ring wirklich geschlossen werden konnte. 

Die heutige Circle Line, die im Lauf der Zeit noch erweitert wurde, umfaßt 35 Stationen auf einer Streckenlänge von 27 Kilometern. Der Simulator stellt diesen heutigen Zustand der Circle Line nach. 

Und das macht er gar nicht mal schlecht. Man findet einen Simulator, dessen Umfang zwar überschaubar, dessen Atmosphäre und Fahrgefühl aber überzeugend ist. Denn wenn die Serie "World of Subways" eines kann, dann ist es, eine Stimmung zu treffen. Das liegt unter anderem an der richtig guten Ausleuchtung, an den scheppernden Sounds und an dem sich ständig ruckelnd bewegenden Rollmaterial. 

Wir müssen unsere U-Bahn erstmal aufrüsten. Dafür müssen wir in einer First-Person-Ansicht zum Zugende laufen und da das Zugschlussignal anschalten. Dann geht es nach vorne, wo wir den Motor starten müssen, das Zugspitzensignal anschalten, Licht im Führerstand und Fahrgastraum anschalten, die Heizung anmachen und natürlich den vorgeschriebenen Bremsentest (im Stand) durchführen. Dann noch das Ansagensystem programmieren und den Zug schildern und schon kann die Fahrt losgehen. Das ist insgesamt komplexer und realistischer als so manches Add-On im Train Simulator. Auch an den Stationen sollten wir die richtigen Durchsagen wählen und natürlich vor dem Türenschließen einen Betriebsblick machen. Kurz gesagt: wenn man will, kann man den Simulator sehr realistisch spielen. Es gibt allerdings auch keine Strafen, wenn wir etwa Betriebsblick und Durchsagen nicht bedienen. Allerdings merkt man auch am Fahrplan, daß man durchaus alle Aktionen machen sollte, denn ansonsten ist man immer wieder viel zu früh an der nächsten Haltestelle. 

In den engen Gängen der U-Bahn, denen man das Alter durchaus anmerkt, tuckern wir meist relativ gemächlich durch die Gegend. An einigen Stellen sind zwar 40 mp/h erlaubt, oft herrschen aber auch Geschwindigkeitsbeschränkungen von 25  oder 30 mph. Mehr würde man aber oft auch gar nicht fahren wollen.

Die Fahrbarkeit ist gut und realistisch. Die U-Bahn hat mehrere Beschleunigungs- und Bremsstufen. Damit kann man durchaus sanft durch die Röhren gleiten, man kann aber auch realistisch ruppig die Fahrgäste ärgern. 

Die Grafik ist uneinheitlich. Einiges, insbesondere die Ausleuchtung unter Tage, ist richtig gut gelungen. Auch die Röhren an sich sind überraschend detailreich gestaltet. Daß die dargestellten Personen in ihren Animationen nicht wirklich überzeugen können, läßt sich bei einem Simulator verschmerzen, denn das ist bei den meisten Vertretern des Genres der Fall. Auf einigen Streckenabschnitten fahren wir auch an der Oberfläche und da bemerkt man doch die Schwächen der Engine. Insbesondere in der Weitsicht ist der Titel schwach. Große Gebäude bauen sich sichtbar auf. Insgesamt ist das optische Erscheinungsbild aber für einen Simulator von 2014 in Ordnung.

Überraschend gut sind die Soundeffekte, die realistisch und satt klingen. Insbeondere das Rattern und Quietschen kann überzeugen. Auch die Ansagen wirken authentisch.

Der Simulator hat auch einige andere kleine Schwächen. So läßt sich unser Fahrer in der First-Person Ansicht nur widerwillig steuern. Da man aber meist im Führerstand sitzt, kommt das nur wenig zum Tragen. Auch das Umschalten zwischen den einzelnen Bedienfeldern im Führerstand ist etwas umständlich geraten. Schade auch, daß man die Fahransicht nicht im Zoom ändern kann. Für Leute mit Wide-Screen Monitor ergibt sich dadurch das Problem, daß man kaum das Bedienfeld noch sehen kann, wenn man im Fahrstand gerade nach vorne schaut.

Viele Kleinigkeiten, die allerdings nicht schwer ins Gewicht fallen, denn der Titel kann insgesamt überzeugen. Auch wenn der Umfang überschaubar ist, ist der dritte Teil der "World of Subways" doch ein solider und gelungener Simulator.

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
8/10 Atmosphäre
-/10 Story
7/10 Grafik
8/10 Sound
7/10 Spielmechanik
7/10 Balancing
7/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Überhaupt nicht unterirdisch.

[h1][b]7/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561198020129525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1666319033}
review:
A proper sim. You've one training lesson, and then you're on your own - everything from turning on the train, programming announcements, and turning on ventilation for passengers, to judging for yourself where to stop, looking out for red lights and speed limits. There's absolutely no hand-holding, and if you pass a red or go too fast, that's it - no try again from the last station - you have to start from the beginning again.

The recreation of the Circle Line seems perfect - I'm not a tube driver so can't comment from that perspective, but can find my way around the stations from real life memory, so it's done with care and attention on that front for sure.

The only criticism I can make, and bearing in mind this is a decade after release, is that there is no option to map controls. Being able to operate the direction selector or brake handle with an axis would improve things massively, but that isn't possible here. 

Despite that, this does a much better job of immersing the player in driving an LU train than more reecent releases. The physics aren't perfect, and the program has a tendency to crash on occasion, but beyond that it's a solid sim, worth picking up on sale (which it almost always is).

review: Got this on steam so I'd finally be able to get rid of the aerosoft launcher, but this version keeps crashing on me. Never managed to finish a complete loop, it always dumps me out to windows after 40 minutes or so. The old aerosoft version didn't do this. Waste of money, typical TML lack of quality control.

review: If you have a laptop connected to an external monitor as your main screen, forget about this game. It will always launch on your laptop screen, if I could say one thing to TML, it would be, "Here's a revolutionary idea, a display monitor option!" Oh, but sometimes it will work fine, I worked for me the first time and now it will not, it always launches on my laptop screen and to make manners worse, it was running in 4K resolution also, so now it is running across my laptop and my main screen in the bottom left corner where I cannot see the resolution options, would refund but can't, fucking lazy, and it really sucks because I actually enjoyed this game but I simply cannot recommend it because, in my experience, I have to jump through so many hoops to play it. The only way I can play this is by using Windows Key+P and selecting duplicate.

review:
This will not work on Windows 10. After two weeks of emails back and forth to the developers who suggested a number of procedures which still didn't solve the issue, their response was along the lines of "well it is an old game now". Unfortunately I had left it too late to get a refund.
Maybe it's time the listing made it clear that Windows 10 isn't supported before anyone else buys something they can't use.
Update:- After a recent Windows 10 update, I decided to reinstall and it now works, although it is rather overshadowed by the excellent Bakerloo line route in TSW2.

author: {'steamid': '76561199021679415', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1594239877}
review: Ok, the game itself is actually very good, the sim level is deep enough to keep you coming back.  Unfortunately there are things wrong with it too.  The main problem is the amount of crashes back to desktop.  I've yet to complete a full timetable because of this, which to be honest, Isn't really acceptable.  But I'm still giving it a thumbs up because despite the crashes, I still want to go back and have another go.  I'm just glad I picked it up in the sale and didn't pay full price, otherwise I would definitely be looking to get a refund.  Another problem is that when you start a timetable service, its not always obvious which is the front and rear of the train, so on numerous occasions I've set the train up incorrectly and headed off in totally the wrong direction! I would like to think the bugs will be fixed, but as the game is 6 years old already, I'm very much doubting that will happen/  Grab it in the sale, but otherwise don't waste your money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127272824', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1592746843}
review:
I'd lean more towards a thumbs in the middle if such an option existed, pick it up on sale if you can.
As it stands, unless want to wait until Train Sim World 2 which features Bakerloo line, or spend a fortune (£100+) on dlc for Train Sim 2020 for Virtual District Line this is pretty much the only other option. When you get everything to work, it's great, it's getting crap to work and the faffing around to get things to work that are a ball-ache. Aside from the crashes, you have to set the train up, which is great for a simulation (childs play compared to setting up a commercial flight on a flight sim, where setting up plane can take longer than the actual flight), and driving itself is literally pressing the up arrow to accelerate and the down arrow to brake, while keeping an eye on signals and sticking to the schedule.
As it stands, this is the best of a bad bunch.

review: Dieses Spiel ist einfach der Hammer! Obwohl es echt schon alt ist konnte mich die Grafik echt überzeugen. Das Fahren macht echt Spaß und es funktioniert alles reibungslos. Die Aufgaben sind teilweise auch easy aber manche stellen einen echt vor eine Herausforderung und man freut sich wenn man diese gemeistert hat. Man kann sich überall an allen Bahnsteigen und im Zug jederzeit frei bewegen und die Steuerung der Züge ist meiner Meinung nach auch gut verständlich und realistisch dargestellt. Da können sich die Spieleentwickler neuerer Spiele echt mal ein Beispiel nehmen. Einer der besten Simulatoren ever!

author: {'steamid': '76561198828713546', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1705346447}
review:
Vous souhaitez jouer à un jeu de simulation de métro Anglais ? Pourquoi regardez-vous ce commentaire alors foncez et achetez-le, comme son nom l'indique, c'est de la pure simulation ! Avec des graphismes ciblé correctes c'est-à-dire que le jeu est bien fait au niveau des stations ainsi que du métro en lui même mais les gens ainsi que le décor extérieur (maison, immeuble, route,etc) ne sont pas bien fait ou  problème financier à la fin peut-être !!! Bref, au niveau des sons, ils sont juste insane, super bien réalisé et la voix et elle aussi excellente mais ce n'est pas exactement la même mais je trouve qu'elle est quand même bien réalisé. Et pour terminé, je vais parler de la difficulté, et bien non ce jeu n'est pas difficile à prendre en main il faut juste regardé peut-être un gars configuré l'IBIS qui est, certes, un peu compliqué mais ça reste assez facile avec le temps et sinon pas besoin de regardé 30 000 tutos pour pouvoir y jouer. Pour conclure si je devais mettre une note elle serait la suivante :
Graphique : 18/20

Sons : 19/20

Difficulté : Facile sauf pour l'IBIS donc 19/20

Moyenne : environ 18.5/20

review: Considering it's age, it is an incredible simulator for the life as a tube driver. There are a few issues, for example the lag when loading in overground buildings, the odd glitch here and there, and the pretty crap first person camera when free roaming, however these are typical of Aerosoft games of that period, with most of the issues found in Omsi. Overall, it's a fantastic game for anyone who is wondering what driving an old C-stock train on the Central Line!

author: {'steamid': '76561198187123963', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1670032893}

author: {'steamid': '76561198965180896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1589886186}
review: It's an old game now, in 2020, but still holds up pretty well with some of the modern stuff. It's a shame that it is still a bit buggy and can crash for no apparent reason, and that would be my biggest complaint of it. It doesn't happen all the time, but when you've almost got the whole way round and back to Edgware Road, and been playing for almost an hour, and it crashes, it's a little frustrating.  The game feels quite immersive, which is helped, I think, by some realistic ambient sounds and announcements. Other more modern train sims could learn something from that. So, overall, yes, the crashes are very frustrating, and I would not accept that in a modern game. But, considering this is now an old game, I like it and can still recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022687136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 71, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1587765643}
review: Хотите красивого подземного виртуального секса? Эта игра вам его предоставит! Красивые картинки (отлично прорисованные станции, поезда, всё вокруг) соседствует с крайне кривым движком. На i7-8700/32Gb/GF1060 игра имеет наглость подтормаживать! Машинист не всегда может нормально зайти в кабину, иной раз просто стопарится. Далее, включи всё как надо и доведя до момента, когда надо ехать, происходит следующее: поезд трогается, проезжает чисто визуально 10-20 см, далее не едет, но при этом слышен звук, словно поезд всё-таки поехал! Никакие танцы с бубнами, многочисленные youtube-мануалы не помогают сдвинуть эту махину с места (а звук поехавшего поезда при этом есть!). В общем, всю красоту портит крайне кривой движок.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119496295', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1343, 'last_played': 1699357134}
review:
It's quite a nice little simulator, with nice detail of the train. However, it's not without its problems.

I've never driven a tube train in my life but if I'm coasting (no power applied and no brake applied) down a hill, I expect the train to speed up, similarly, when I'm coasting up a hill, I expect it to slow down. It doesn't.
It also would've been nice if they included perhaps the H&C and/or District lines too, just so there's something else to do.
It penalises me for not setting announcements up correctly (despite doing so) and not putting the heating on (even when it was), which is slightly annoying but I just ignore it - I don't care for scoring systems in simulators anyway.
Also, in the adverts for holidays (and possibly other stuff) at stations, you put the £ sign BEFORE the price, not after (so £350, not 350£) ;) - very nit-picky I know but just something I picked up.

So yeah, if you can get it for a cheap price, I'd definitely recommend picking it up. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198955095846', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1707340439}

author: {'steamid': '76561198053614052', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 610, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1587598431}
review:
14,95 EUROS? NI  LOCO!

Aún así lo recomiendo pero cómpralo por menos de 5 sino creo yo que te arrepentirás. 
Mis razones:

LO MALO:
- Es un juego de TML-Studios (Aerosoft)(y del 2014!) => Eso implica un nefasto y pobre tutorial. Un desprecio absoluto por el modo en que el usuario tiene que interactuar con todo y pocas opciones jugables.

- Es un juego del 2014. Su apartado gráfico como es lógico deja que desear. Tiene de vez en cuando algún lag (juego con SSD y 16Gb de RAM). La iluminación es antigua y brusca con algún bug. La distancia de visión dentro de los túneles hace que veas a veces como luz al final del túnel (distancia de visión) cuando no tenía que haberla). Etc. etc.

- El control del personaje fuera del tren es prehistórico e injusto para un gamer con un poco de dignidad.

LO BUENO: 
- Es un juego de TML-Studios (Aerosoft) => Eso implica que a nivel de simulación el juego cumple y muy bien. Es ahí donde esta gente sabe hacer las cosas. No esperes en este juego una profundidad abismal por que todo es bastante simple pero bien hecho. Sobre todo destaco el sonido: todo! el chirriar de las ruedas, la gente en el metro, el movimiento del tren, cómo responde al frenar o acelerar, la puertas al abrirse, etc. 

- La ambientación de las estaciones, el interior de la cabina donde conducimos y el interior de los túneles. Todo muy logrado.

- Tiene muchos tramos exteriores (Circle Line del  London Underground real) por lo que no estarás todo el rato dentro de un monótono túnel.

En serio, me gustaría un remaster o actualización de este juego.
Lo recomiendo, eso sí ni loco pagues el precio normal. No lo vale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145024832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1690, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1700172256}
{'steamid': '76561198118698432', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1660399661}
review:
So here's a game where the developer's have spent months, maybe years writing the basic graphics engine. Then perhaps with a deadline looming, they've thrown together the actual game over the top.

But actually the problem is the tutorial more than the simulator itself. And once you see the excellent youtube videos of how to play the game, you can just ignore the fussy tutorial, and jump straight in.

A lot is wrong, spelling mistakes and poor mistranslated English are everywhere. Change the key bindings, and the prompts that tell you what to do remain with the original and now wrong keys.  Controls are poor, and inconsistent. I've still to work out how I can look around the right hand door at a station without physically going outside. The walking speed is about three times too slow. Why can't I move left and right when I run?  Why is the physics of this game so intolerably awful, walking through walls, or through closed train doors? 

I've edited my original review and changed to recommend, as there is some fun to be had. But there could have been a real game here: why not count passenger numbers, give a score on how near the schedule you are, these kind of thing would be trivial to add and would give something to aim for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198873642463', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 316, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1575914997}
review: Very poor. First refund I have requested on a game in steam. The tutorial is awful. Several key allocations simply do not work. Unable to see the settings on various switches, levers etc. This is not due my pc or graphics card I hasten to add. The game simply crashes if you fail part of the "missions" ie. you cannot restart the game, it simply closes the game and you have to reload the game. I have other titles from TML, and I am afraid they should feel ashamed offering this for sale or even giving it away. To add insult to injury Steam refused my refund request as I had played it for just over 2 hours. Considering how often it crashed and how poor the tutorial is, I actually played the game less than 2 hours certainly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049941986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1575147778}
review:
Приобрел игру еще в 2015-ом году, незадолго после выхода версии, запускаемой через Aerosoft Launcher.

В начале 2000-ых выход 1-ой части World of Subways натурально встряхнул рынок железнодорожных симуляторов и заставил всех без исключения "корифеев жанра" срочно подтягиваться до того же уровня. Судите сами - впервые в жанре:
- симуляция раскачивания камеры на ходу и при ходьбе
- возможность перемещаться на ногах и играть за аватар с видом из глаз.
- динамическое освещение и вменяемые тени
- дождевые капли на стеклах
- эффекты постобработки картинки, HDR и размытие.

Отрадно видеть, что с тех пор не сделано ровным счетом ничего для повышения стабильности работы движка, особенно на 64-битных системах. Игра по прежнему постоянно вылетает, причем в полноэкранном режиме не даст даже выгрузить себя из памяти без перезагрузки системы. Творение TML Studios так и не доросло до полноценного симулятора, а с выходом Train Simulator World можете и подавно смело отложить WoS на полку - благо, обе одноразовые, редактора не дождетесь и от Dovetail Games, метро они - рано или поздно - либо сделают сами, либо купят у наиболее пряморуких сторонних разработчиков. Но Train Simulator World хотя бы написан на современном Unreal Engine 4 и не доставит вам проблем с совместимостью.

Резюме:
Учитывая пластмассовую физику поездов, устаревшую графику и крайне нестабильный самописный движок, не связывайтесь, благо все практически то же самое можно делать в Train Simulator World.

review:
Do you want to drive a tube train? Okay good.
Do you want to learn how to drive it with optimalized tutorials? Fuck you.
Do you have a dual monitor setup and would like to use the game on your main screen? Fuck you, screen No.2 it is.
Do you have any idea of how to program the announcer if you don't follow a crappy youtube tutorial from 2012? No? OKay fuck you, find it out on your own lol. '
Wanna fall through the void? Yes? okay good!
If anyone of these criterias apply to you, then feel free to pick up the game

author: {'steamid': '76561198187797959', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1569360942}
review:
Das mit der Grafik lassen wir einfach mal so da hingestellt. Schließlich ist das Spiel ja schon 2014 released worden. Dass das Spiel jedoch so verbugged ist, dass es einfach ohne jeglichen Crashreport abstürzt und man nach fast eineinhalb Stunden fahren auf einer Strecke noch mal von vorne anfangen müsste, da natürlich auch eine Funktion wie Autosave fehlt toppt das ganze aus meiner Sicht. 

Ich finde die Idee eigentlich sehr gut, auch dass es so viele Linien gibt (vorausgesetzt man kann diese auch starten/spielen) jedoch gibt es einfach riesengroße Minuspunkte! 

1. Tutorial zu unverständlich
2. zu viele Spielabstürze (fünf in ca. 120 Minuten)
3. Sounddesign (oder sind einfach die Fahrerkabinen so schlecht isoliert, dass man bei der Durchfahrt eines Bahnhofes sogar die Ansagen lauter hört als das eigentliche Fahrgeräusch der Garnitur?)


wenigstens sind die Tunnel mit einigen Details ausgeschmückt. 

Fazit: nicht kaufen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088829328', 'num_games_owned': 2963, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1569006289}
review:
More bugs than Badgerwatch...

First attempt at "Briefing" (the tutorial) had me following "Danny"`s instructions, all well and good until I had to exit the rear cabin, (after turning on the brake lights...), ....and follow `Danny`....

"Danny" immediately walked straight up to the young female (pictured) 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1868110160

and started dry-humping her back repeatedly.. and despite me trying my best, this is where he remained...

(There may have been a little drool running out of his mouth and a lot of heavy breathing, but I suppose that could just have been my imagination...).

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1868110358

So I pressed escape to try again, and the game crashed.

The next attempt had Danny doing exactly the same to a MALE passenger, (takes all sorts I guess), I might have excused this but the gent concerned was the single solitary passenger standing ANYWHERE on the platform.

"Danny" was clearly a pervert.

Attempt no 3 had me racing through the rear cab procedure in order to get old perv-boy up front and into the drivers cab before anybody else with 2 legs and a pulse sent him into another dry humping frenzy.  I managed to achieve this and quickly shut the door... I was shown the controls and attempted to leave the station slowly...

At which point the controls ceased responding & my subway train flew through a red light like a bat out of hell. This triggered a stern message and a single control "End Game"

I obeyed the message but pressing the button induced its second game crash, I briefly saw a windows error message & then the screen flickered, the game reset itself, and it loaded itself up again.

At this point I gave up.

The End.

(Badum-Tisss).

author: {'steamid': '76561198120455891', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 5668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5048, 'last_played': 1710060636}
review: Games not finished. Ride this to the end and you can carry on driving the train despite it not being on the tracks, you go through some game developer textures, which is a grey grid that says 1x1 on it and then you carry on driving your train on no tracks through the dirt fields and can see the outside of the game. It's quite amazing they didn't stop this from happening and didn't add a proper end to the tracks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144028810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 645, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1594376945}
review:
This game is pretty awesome, and enjoyable to play.

A few things i wish the game has in the future updates, is something that indicate how many miles there is remaining in each tutorial-mission before they end, so i know when to stop completely, and maybe the passengers will stand or walk on the platform, when not boarding the train, instead of walking or walk mid-air out on the tracks.

The small things i wish could be changed, are no big deal, but a few more updates will surely make it better ;-)  

br. Lucas

author: {'steamid': '76561198125731515', 'num_games_owned': 108, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1564645373}
review:
Peli on muutaman vuoden vanha, mutta simulaation realistisuus [i]tuntuu aidolta[/i] (en ole koskaan käynyt Lontoossa, mutta muiden arvostelujen perusteella autenttisuuskin on hyvin onnistunut) ja grafiikat ovat muihin samanlaisiin simulaattoreihin verrattuna hieman keskitasoa paremmat. Jopa niin, että heikohkolla läppärin i5-suorittimella ja 960M-näytönohjaimella pystyn samalla kuvaamaan OBS:lla videon myös YouTubeen.

Pelin tutoriaali voisi olla hieman parempi, mutta netistähän löytyy paljon videoita, jos jossakin jää jumiin. Yleisesti ottaen peli on kuitenkin tehtävineen ja "free play" -toiminnon ansiosta erittäin onnistunut.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010449532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1645299361}
review:
Quite old game (I have it since the release but not on Steam), but still fun to drive an underground train in London. It needs a little bit learning how to drive the train, but after a little while it became easy. Nice to have the sounds of the passenger information system. The graphic could be better, but still acceptable.
If you like driving trains and have ever been to London once and traveled on the real one, I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198880455023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1561637770}
review: The game itself is realistic with amazing detail and rolling stock. However, it is also too realistic. When you accidentally go over line-speed or go past a red signal, its game over. Being an urban railway, there are many "jumpscare" red signals, so if you do want to play, you need to be focused. Apart from that downside, the game itself has a pretty big potential which is a bit of a shame.

author: {'steamid': '76561198450428284', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 65, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1561540181}
review: The actual core gameplay itself is pretty good, especially for a game that came out in 2011. The graphics have held up well and the tutorial does a decent job of teaching you how to operate the tube and it's not as difficult as some people make it out to be. Unfortunately I just can't recommend this game, even on a discount which is when I picked it up, due to constant game crashes. It will crash when you're adjusting graphics settings, when you're on route or when the game loads which just hampers the enjoyment of the game. A real shame because I was really looking forward to this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109076814', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1630827739}
review:
NOTE: This game was purchased for 75% off ($3.75 USD) during a steam sale. 

As enjoyable as this somewhat janky simulator is, it falls short due to much technical incompetence. The game runs very poorly when graphics options are enabled, but nicely when they are disabled, so it seems the mirrors and shadows options are not optimized (I'm talking about an 90 FPS difference between on and off here...) 

Then there's the crashing. I had it crash on me a total of four times in an hour. Most of these were when I would return to the main menu and attempt to edit Graphics options, which would result in either a runtime error (which requires task manager to kill) or a CTD crash.  There were also instances in which the game hitched and froze for a few seconds. Mind you that this PC can run games like BeamNG drive and Grand Theft Auto V at over 100 FPS, but it can't keep this game above 50 with options enabled. This game is quite old now and the game hasn't been updated in ages, so don't expect these issues to ever get resolved.

The game has many strong points, though. Sound design is one of them. I've never been on a London Underground train since I'm a dumb American, but I can tell the sound effects were thought through and elegantly designed. The game doesn't look awful, but when you turn down the settings it most certainly does, with noticeable pop-in and some bad texture work on character models. 

But despite all this, the game still gets a thumbs up from me [b]at its reduced sale price[/b] because it's leagues ahead of Train Simulator. In Train Simulator you can sit for over a half an hour bored out of your mind between stations or speed limit changes, but as you would expect from a subway line, stations are frequent which keeps you engaged and attentive, listening to the heartfelt clatters of the train cars and praying you won't go past a red signal.

FINAL SCORE: 6/10
IN A NUTSHELL: FUN, BUT EXPECT THE GAME TO CRASH MORE THAN THE TRAINS THEMSELVES DO.

[i]Was this review helpful? Leave a thumbs up if it was! You can read more about how I review my games by using [url=https://i.imgur.com/cSoKszD.png] this link.[/url] All of my game reviews can be found [url=https://steamcommunity.com/id/Agera153/recommended/]here[/url].[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198082967459', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1677862897}
review: 这系列一向对新人不太友好。3代算是做得比较亲民了。4代全键盘操作有点崩溃。他默认很多按钮是小键盘上的，但笔记本并没有小键盘这东西。所以要自己修改，调试，才能开得顺手。画面也就那样了，毕竟是老游戏，但车辆晃动是不是大了点？另外这游戏看预告似乎是可以当一名乘客享受旅途的，但要如何进入乘客模式？总不能直接弃车去坐别的车吧，貌似会引起塞车的。不管怎么样，现在这类专线电车模拟游戏已经非常少了。有一款就玩一款吧。任何况这一款的质量还过得去。

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198009076344', 'num_games_owned': 519, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1559408115}
review:
Warning for those with more than one monitor!

I'd love to give this game ago, but like many players of simulation games I have a three monitor set up, the game doesn't display on my primary display, it only will display on my second (left) monitor. There is no option to move the game, borderless window option, and in windowed mode the game snaps back onto my left monitor if I move so unfortunately this game is unplayable for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160418147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1602596003}
review:
Straight forward: A good game!

Yes, it is old. And no it's not optimized well... But the feeling of simulation is high in this game, and so are the details that make it feel realistic. There's sadly just a few scenarios and one line. As well as one single train in the whole game, but apart of that it's well worth the money. I got it on sale for 3$ but would still recmend it for higher prices. 

For you that love simulation games and want an realistic experienc, as well as a rather relaxing game: this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198288111220', 'num_games_owned': 48, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1694208013}
review:
For a game that was released in 2011 It still is quite a good game to play considering the fact that the game isn't fully accurate to what the real life line is like.

Is it still worth playing though at £13?
Yes, however the game has not had any updates or optimization fixes and even with a 1070 the game barely manages to get over 60fps with max settings on.

It better than games such as Train Simulator?
No, even though Train Simulator has been out since 2008 known as Rail Simulator and has masses of optimization issues itself, it is still better due to it having over 100's of downloadable content and the ability to install mods.

author: {'steamid': '76561198426110662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1626406247}
review:
总的来说很有意思，但是优化不太好，有bug，且某些操作完全没有提示。
下面有一些自己摸索出来的问题给铁汁们一些参考：
1.某些月台两段有红色的可互动的开关，那个其实是附近灯的开关
2.剧情任务第一个是新手教程，任务会带你启动列车后跑一次不停靠的完整线路
3.自由驾驶到终点站后停好列车，下车后到末尾车箱或者其他车厢的驾驶室按进入坐下即可获得本次任务的评分及改善建议

不过我一直没太弄懂的是英国地铁的停车标到底在哪里，每次车头对着月台最前面的栏杆停却还是提示有车厢没有进入月台
希望有知道的老铁不吝赐教！谢谢！

author: {'steamid': '76561198305669335', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1548858227}
review: 我不知道这么多好评是怎么来的。游戏体验极差，建模不完整，你可以试试从站台上跳到铁轨上，会直接掉出世界。连个新手教程都没有，虽然说操作简单，但也失去了很多乐趣。游戏里旅客上下车的时候经常会卡在门上。。选择好了区间，到了终点站，然后？？一点反应都没有的吗？？最后还是手动退出游戏。不得不说这款游戏虽然路上的细节处理到位，但是就这个游戏体验根本不值怎么多钱。还是乖乖滚回去玩TSW

author: {'steamid': '76561198026662582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 961, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 560, 'last_played': 1586611107}
review:
The crashing to desktop needs to be fixed. I run this of a I9-9900k with 16GB DDR4 3200mhz RAM paired with a GTX 1080ti and i like some other people cannot finish certain parts of the game, due to crashes.

For example when playing the "Briefing" mission, sometimes it will crash unexpectadely.

Also, if i choose to play a scheduled route instead, say, the first route: Edgware Road to Hammersmith, it will crash between Farringdon & Barbican. This is regular.

Otherwise I really enjoy the sim, at least in part due to the fact I have always had a fascination with the tube network since it was built in the 19th century. The sounds and lighting in this game really capture the true feel of travelling on the tube. When going over rail track changes for example, there is a noticeable cabin vibration, accompanied by realistic sounds of this happening (that typical clunk of metal sound). Having used the tube for 10 or so years of my life, this was as realistic as I could get in a sim, that wasnt sitting in it myself. Also, if you have ever visited the National Transport Museum in London, you will note how similar this is to the simulator they have there inside an actual stock car cutout. So many memories of playing that on our visits as a child! Not sure if it is still there today, but for those of us who were children in the 90's i'm sure you can remember it, if you did visit!

To the devs, please fix the crashes, i would be happy to provide any debug info if needed to help myself and others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198387259002', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1702867125}
review:
This game is amazing and is what are simulator is supposed to be amazing and feel like the real thing and as someone who has been in the London Under Ground stations a lot I can say this game does a good job
Advanges:
-Great Graphics-

author: {'steamid': '76561198173253478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1547850134}
review:
[h1] Rate: 6.5/10. Recommended audience: People with half a brain, patience, and some skill. [/h1]

[i] It's not that bad. [/i]

Pretty much 70% of these reviews are positive, 15% are complaining about how it's 'too difficult', 10% on poor performance / crashes, and the odd 5% with tiny issues that apparently affect the entire game.
The game isn't hard and it's easy to get started with it (the main controls that is, not the DVA and stuff). Performance is fine and I've never had a crash.


[h1] Pros [/h1]
+ Detailed track and trains
+ Graphics are pretty good, certainly when it's raining and you see the fog clearing out when you turn on the AC
+ Pretty realistic, in regards to braking distance
+ Great sounds, makes it feel like you're actually in a Tube train
+ Easy (for me at least)
+ Native RailDriver support
+ Comprehensive manual


[h1] Cons [/h1]
- Repetitive and may get boring quickly
- Lags when it rains
- Some weird distance and lighting glitches
- It's difficult to know which setting the TBC is on if you're not paying close attention, which is the only issue in regards to controls
- Small but irritating: the whistle audio doesn't end smoothly
- I know why it's a thing, but passing signals at danger game endings are a bit annoying
- [b] BIGGEST ISSUE OF ALL [/b] (in my opinion): in all of my routes I just can't get the hang of the DVA and the Automatic Announcements. Kind of the same with the destination board. However, I am getting better at it, so just practice and it (sometimes) works


[u] In conclusion, [/u] if you're looking for a semi-realistic and somewhat repetitive driving experience and if you have any knowledge of common sense, then this is the game for you.
If you're just looking to play around with some trains, this isn't the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262460853', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2027, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1688081104}
review:
Ce World Of Subways 3 est un vrai plaisir pour ceux qui aiment les jeux de simualtion/train.

Pour être allé à Londres récemment, les stations de la Circle sont très bien réalisés ( le matériel sur la Circle à changé entre temps )
Niveau prise en main, celle-ci est assez facile grâce au petit tutoriel au début du jeu.
Le fait de pouvoir contrôler son personnage est un bon point on configure notre rame tout de A à Z, les vues sont assez limités en revanche.
Un conseil pour ceux qui ont ou qui vont avoir le jeu : Pensez à activer l'alimentation du tunnel qui est parfois pas activé, cela s'active par un boitier avec un logo eclair en bout de quai. Pensez en revenant dans la cabine de confirmer le Dead Man.
Un autre bon point : le Français est disponible dans le jeu sauf que les accents n'apparaissent pas, a vous d'en déduire certains mots.

Un mauvais point : beaucoup de "glitches", en effet il y a pas mal de problème de collision ( parfois il y en a pas là ou il doit en avoir comme sur les rails et aussi parfois la ou il doit pas en avoir comme sur les quais, on est obligé de passer par la rame parfois. )
C'est dommage que les heures de pointe avec les quais "bondés" n'ont pas été pris en compte dans ce jeu qui aurait apporté plus de réalisme.


[b] Conclusion : [/b] Un avis mitigé sur ce jeu, graphiquement ce jeu est bien fait et est très réaliste ( surtout le fait d'être dans la peau d'un conducteur et de tout "configuerer" ) mais les bugs peuvent ruiner l'immersion de jeu.
Pour ne pas ruiner l'immersion de ce jeu essayez :
- De ne pas sauter sur les voies
- De ne pas sauter sur les voies depuis votre train
- De ne pas vous promener sur les murs des quais de train, certains n'ont pas de collision.
- De ne pas sortir du métro par les portes qui sont fermées quand vous êtes un passager car les vitres des portes ont pas de collision.
- De ne pas griller un feu ou de dépasser les limitations. Ces derniers font fermer le jeu.
Si vous respectez ces derniers, votre immersion dans le jeu sera totale !

author: {'steamid': '76561198304956069', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 4404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 1163, 'last_played': 1711882270}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138410849', 'num_games_owned': 126, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1529597879}
review:
The extensive work of the studio should be appreciated, but there are two major issues:

1. Learning curve is a bit steep, and it's not very easy to control the thing using mouse.  Should include hot-keys in the tutorials, as well as highlighting where to click.

2. I found there are quite a lot of inaccuracies, especially that they seem deliberately eradicating the visual evidence of the Metropolitan main line (no trains, and even Baker Street Junction is missing).  The curve seems not correct along the north side of the circle as well.

Sadly the BVE simulator route (free, made about 10 years prior to this game, and probably out of reach) was very much the better make.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036773195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1529787538}
review:
After trying for a long while, setting my main monitor to be the main monitor in Display settings, getting "Borderless Gaming" from steam.  Setting the graphics in the game to be non-full screen, trying ALT-ENTER, and various other things, I still cannot get the game to work on the correct monitor.  Instead it insists to be stuck on my small secondary monitor which is unplayable. 

  As for game play, the controls are buggy, multiple crashes and a bugs where you fall through the tracks outside the game, only to be placed in a mission at a train you can't control.  Mission instructions are vague and don't reflect keybinding changes.  Many times I've found myself stuck in the seat or between the seat and lighting controls unable to move without re-starting.

  Very disappointed as a frequent traveler on the London Underground (though very rarely on the Circle Line), I had high expectations to see how accurate the stations were and have fun with something I'm very familiar with...

author: {'steamid': '76561198439084577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1525352946}
review:
Первоначально очень сильно подкупили скриншоты, тематика мной очень любима. Однако на лицо факт того что движок и управление очень устарели. Все смотрится слишком сумбурно, на отвали. При этом жутко заскриптовано. Главный герой не может ходить назад, а звук шага ребята поскупились записать только один, на второй то ли желания то ли денег не хватило.
И вроде бы режимы есть достойные и функционал тоже и локации неплохие. Но вместо туториала я получаю безумный геморой. Даже с учетом того что мне говорит товарищ старший по званию в обучении, поезд не трогается. Знаю можно как бы и мануалы почитать, и еще пару тройку десятков минут потратить - но как-то после таких продуктов как TS и TSW здесь я лично чувствую халяву от разработчиков. В итоге первая моя игра в стиме - за которую я решил вернуть деньги. 
Причем если бы игра стоила сотню-другю - окей, будь настроение я бы ее еще попробовал обуздать. Но 6 сотен за такое и это с учетом 50% скидки и получить такое.. хм, нет спасибо.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099502852', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1057, 'last_played': 1525444279}
review:
Unfortunately this game is horribly unpolished. As a simulator it does a few things well but unfortunately the experience is tainted by bugs and a bad UI.
Here are some gripes I have with it:

1. The game allows you to walk around the platforms and within the trains. However this is horribly implemented with ("Tank-like") controls that wont allow you to even walk backwards. When boarding a train I get contantly stuck on things which makes it almost impossible to navigate the passenger compartments (required to do in several missions).

2. The game is quite difficult to run smoothly (stutters every 20 seconds or so unless graphics are turned down quite a bit (GTX770).

3. The passengers that board and leave your train are animated clunkily and walk like zombies. Often they will get stuck on doors or on each other or just fall from the sky or fall through the floor before boarding your train (purely visual).

4. The manual is very lackluster, especially in explaining how the voice announcer programming works. I have tried all manner of combinations following the manual and yet I always get the "wrong announcements" warning at the end.

5. Saving is not possible during scenario missions.  This means that you are forced to play through 45+ minute missions in one go.

6. The scoring system is unintuitive and feels bugged (I always get the "too hard braking" message even when the hardest braking I used was the 1st setting...)

My biggest gripe however, is that the simulator feels very static. Once you have understood the routine of setting up a train and driving it your experience will never change. 
For example: 
The doors will always close no matter what. There is never any reason to open the driver door and check that they are safely closed (although this is implemented via hotkey).
The train will never fail a brake test. 
The signals always seem very predictable. A setting to make the signals more aggressive or passive would have been nice.
There are things like tunnel lighting (switch is on the platform), a horn and passenger heating, but as far as i can tell there is never any reason to use them (the game does not seem to register these). 
The only thing that changes are the lighting and weather effects. 
The only gauge that actually works in the cab view is the speedometer. Essential information (like timetable, and clock) must be accessed via an ugly overlay that totally breaks immersion.

Overall I can only recommend this game to hardcore fans of the London Underground. The circle line is modeled quite nicely after all. However if you expect a good subway simulator or rail simulator in general, look elsewhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212666903', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1531052885}
review:
Niè... poteva essere migliore.

Non offre una grande disponibilità di percorsi. E' sempre la stessa linea, 1 o 2 in più non sarebbero state male.
Non è possibile guidare proprio liberamente. Le missioni hanno percorsi prestabiliti.
Odio non poter alzare il volume direttamente con i tasti del pc...
Alcuni piccoli bug, ma ci sta.

La grafica non è male: carti particolari come ruggine, invecchiamento ecc in cabina sono molto graditi.
L'esperienza di guida è buona. Freni e acceleratore realistici nei tempi di risposta, sitema di programmazione percorsi tramite centralina, apertura porte... come nella realtà insomma.

Complessivamente è sufficiente, ma si poteva fare di più.

[i]6.5/10[/i]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068663435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1706780530}
review:
This game is a pretty good game, but I do have some problems with it:

It is very strict with missions, so, for example, if you don't set up the train perfectly, it's game over.
The game is very glitchy/buggy and sometimes I can walk through walls and through to places it shouldn't let me. Also, sometimes, it doesn't let me walk when I am in first person view; I need to be in third person.
The game is never updated, so the latest trains aren't added.

Overall, the game is very realistic looking, especially for 2011 (the year it was released), however, it would be really nice if TML could update the game in the future. But, what I think they will do is release a brand new WOS game that goes back to the London Underground.

author: {'steamid': '76561198213636039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2292, 'last_played': 1653502273}
review: This game was really good at the start, but i soon realised it was compleely unrealistic. some areas of the map had a 30 speed limit, but relied on you being slow from pulling out of the station, otherwise you would derail. the tunnels are unrealistic and the startup/shutdown is completely simplified. I would ONLY recommend this if you have very little knowledge of trains and just want a little game as it isn't suited to anyone wishing to drive for hours on end, or with tight and interesting procedures learned from the real world, such as myself. Summary: If you're a rail enthusiast, you would be better off saving the money and getting another train sim, HOWEVER if you are someone whom doesn't know all that much about trains or how they work in general, you might find it to be perfectly enjoyble. Thanks for reading!

author: {'steamid': '76561198141794958', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1695247600}
review:
In my opinion, I think this game is an extremely enjoyable game to play and is (from my eyes) one of the best train simulators you can get on the market today (I don't have many train sims though). There are a lot of interesting mechanics in this game that make this game very unique and enjoyable. However, although this game is superb it does come with its issues and some of which require immediate attention. [b]Don't be fooled by my play time. I currently own a hard copy of the game which I have played much more.[/b]

Firstly, this game really does stand out compared to other simulators such as Train simulator generally because of the idea of you being an actual person doing their job rather than just sitting in a train and off you go. I love the concept of the missions which also make the game extremely unique. However, being able to wonder around the stations is one of the best side features for this game. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who wants something different than just driving.

Secondly, the detail is extraordinarily high. One thing that I look for in games is detail and boy, this game definitely checks all the boxes. When I bought this game, it was on an older computer therefore, I was unable to run it properly. However, recently, I receieved a new computer which I can play this on and therefore realise how much detail and effort was put into this game. All the stations have their own unique style to them which *should* (I say should because I have never been on the underground before) be nearly identical to their real life counterparts. I can definitely see with the detail shown in the stations that there was a lot of research that went into this game - much more than World of Subways 4 anyway. The detail is just amazing.

There are much more incredible things that are in this game which make is so amazing. But because I am quite a critial person I am going to move onto the "bad stuff." In this game there are numerous bugs that seriously need repairing. One of the ones that require that most amount of attention is a bug I noticed when you change a certain graphics option.

In the hard copy of the game Version 1.5 did not exist. I bought the game a while ago while it was on Version 1.3 (the hard copy that is) and I have to say that there is near to no game threatening bugs in that version. However, when buying this steam version (with Version 1.5 in it) I have noticed a massive bug that really requires attention from the developers end; although my PC is good, it is not the best of PCs therefore (like most people) you would change the graphics so that people would be able to get the most out of the game. Unfortunately, for me I have an issue with shadows in this game and cannot have them on without my framerate dropping from 60 FPS to around 40 FPS. Now I am not sinning that specific graphic option. I have noticed that if you turn that option off, when you are in first person or you get pushed into first person, you cannot move at all. You can move the camera but not the character. This really does require attention because every time you walk into the cab you get pushed into first person and get stuck which isn't the best and it ruins the game.

I have only noticed this issue with the steam version and not the hard copy on version 1.3 so I think there is a software issue with that. Furthermore, the text is a little off when you hover over things in this steam version however that isn't a game changing bug it is just a visual annoyance.

Overall, this game is exceptional. I think it really is an interesting game to play and I really love to play the hard copy of the game. However, if your computer isn't powerful enough to run the shadows then I would recommend buying the hard copy from amazon.

However, this game really is extraordinary and I really love playing it. It is just a couple of bugs with 1.5 that really require a bit of attention before this game is at it absolute best. I would really love to see some more lines put in (like being able to drive D stocks around the underground in the district line or implementing some S stocks as well to keep up with the times).

Generally, the choice is yours. I would reccomend buying this game. However, I would buy the hard copy of the game until this bug is fixed (who knows it might just be my PC messing up hehe).

I recommend the steam version for anyone who has a good enough PC to run the shadows. However, I would buy the hard copy off of amazon or Aerosoft if you have a PC like mine which can't run shadows. But I would recommend this game either way to anyone who is in to train simulators.

Thanks for reading and enjoy playing.

review: Good in theory, bad in practice. The concept of the game is great, they've got all the gameplay and mechanics to work but when you aren't in a train the game is just awful. The camera moves too much in 1st person and in 3rd person the animations just look cheesey. There are tons of ways to get out of the game and you can just out of a train and enf up on one in the opposite direction. This game was made in 2014 and the new s stock was introduced in about 2010 so why did they not make an effort to put it in and just use the old sub-surface c stock and d stock. author: {'steamid': '76561198344937891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 897, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1530003558}
review:
Wer schon immer einmal davon träumte, mit einer U-Bahn durch London zu fahren muss jetzt noch nicht einmal aufstehen. Mit WORLD OF SUBWAYS 3 werden sie zum U-Bahnfahrer.

Spiel ist dafür, dass es schon im Jahr 2013 erschienen ist schon relativ umfangreich.
Die Grafik ist gut(1-).
 Der Sound ist akzepttabel (2-).
 Der Realismusfaktor hält sich in Grenzen, da zum Beispiel die Größe der U-Bahn nicht real seien kann. Außerdem fällt man beim Betreten des Gleisbettes durch die Karte, das heist, dass alle Objekte keine Gravitation besitzen.(3-)
Die Performance ist gut(2). 
Leider gibt es noch viele Bugs.
Der Spielspaß ist noch akzeptablel, da wenn man zum Beispiel eine längere Strecke fährt, die Fahrt auf Dauer ziemlich langweilig(3)
Der Preis-Leistungs Faktor ist katastrophal. Für ein 2013 erschienenes Spiel mit leicht überdurchscnittlichen Qualität immer noch über 20 € zu verlangen ist nicht akzeptabel (4-).

FAZIT:
Das Spiel läuft flüssig und in einer Guten Grafik. Der Sound ist OK. Leider gibt es immer noch einige Bugs. Aber das Spiel ist überteuert. Es ist nur für U-Bahn Fans zu empfehlen. 
Trozdem empfehle ich dieses Spiel jedem der gerne einaml U-Bahn fahren möchte. Wer nicht allzu viel Geld in der Tasche hat, sollte dann vieleicht doch zum Vorgänger WORLD OF SUBWAYS 2-Berlin Line 7 greifen.
Ich bewerte das Spiel insgesamt mit der Note  3.
(Die Note erschließt sich aus allen Bewertungen, die in dem Review genannt wurden.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197982999533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 230, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1506707130}
review:
월드 오브 서브웨이의 세번째 작품 '런던 지하철 순환선' 입니다.
 
2011년에 나온 게임이라고는 믿기지 않을 정도로 세세하고 정밀하게 조작이 가능하며 제대로 된 전철 승무 느낌을 받을수 있습니다.

더구나 추가 DLC 필요 없이 이 가격에 이 정도 컨텐츠만 매우 훌륭한 것 같습니다.

전철/기차 시뮬레이션을 좋아하시는 분들에게는 더할 나위가 없는 게임이라고 생각 됩니다.



중 *한국/일본 윈도우 7을 사용하시는 분들* 요


아마 다운로드를 하고 실행하면 밑에 보이는 에러 메세지가 뜰껍니다.

ERROR: Could not load VisionEnginePlugin.vPlugin(D)

이는 유니코드 에러 때문에 생기는문제로 이 문제를 해결하는 방법을 밑에 적어두도록 하겠습니다.


1) steam을 일단 종료합니다.

2) 이 게임이 설치되어있는 폴더 이름 "World of Subways 3 – London Underground Circle Line"에 포함되어있는 문자 " – "*1 을 " - "*2 로 바꿔주세요.

* 1 " – "(Unicode U + 2013) en 대시
* 2 " - "(Unicode U + 002D) 하이픈 <- 북붙해서 이걸로 바꿔줍니다.

3) steamapps 폴더에 있는 파일 "appmanifest_283620.acf"을 찾아서 메모장에서 연 다음 "name"과 "InstallDir"의 값도 폴더 이름과 똑같이 교체 해주시면 됩니다.

4) steam을 시작하고 게임을 시작합니다.


<해결방법을 올려주신 noobchan 님에게 감사드립니다.>

author: {'steamid': '76561198032776165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1553303323}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]

Overall, it's a pretty good sim. Graphics are fine, the route is done pretty well, and the ability to walk around your train and the stations is pretty cool. I can recommend it, but be prepared for something that will not work perfectly 100% of the time, but is done much better than other TML games like Fernbus Simulator or the following part of the World of Subways, WoS 4. 

[h1]What works[/h1]
1. Graphics are pretty decent.
2. The train is pretty well-detailed and most of the switches work, including the automatic announcer which is a very nice touch. I really hate those supposedly realistic trains from other games where most of the switches don't work at all. 
3. I don't share complains about controls. Those pretty fine for me and easy to use.
4. Route is pretty fun and varied.
5. It's pretty simple to learn and not that hard to master. Ideal for a casual game to play in the evening, and it's really fun to do everything you can to keep on schedule.

[h1]What doesn't work[/h1]
1. Stability. The game crashes way too often, and so far I was only able to finish full schedule once. Before that, the game crashed sometime after 30-40 mins. That's definitely not acceptable, especially that long after the game was released.
2. Controls outside the train. They're extremely clunky, and you can easily get stuck inside the cabin and have to wait until you're unstuck. 
3. Character models. You created a game where you encounter other characters, make them at least passable. 
4. A bug prevented me from completing the tutorial. It didn't want to go through after going inside the front driver's cabin.

review: This could be a great game/simulator.  The tutorials and overall usability is great, and it's very easy to pick up on how to drive the train. However I found it's very strict in punishing you - speeding or doing something wrong results in ending your mission. Also found that some of the controls don't respond well - either it takes a few keyboard presses for it to register or just not at all.  At $10 I'd put up with it, but not at $25. Will be asking for a refund.

review: This is a great London Underground simulator, then this is the best you can get. There are a few problems such as the automated announcements announcing the wrong station despite the correct stations being input, but the detail that you go through on the Circle Line is great. It covers from setting up both front and back cabs, running through a service, between 15min and 1:30 hours, and ending that service.

review:
It has it's flaws, like any other transport simulator. As usual it sucks the most when you try and walk around. With that said, the driving and the detail of the stations and what not is great. 

I'm a train driver myself, and have tried most of the steel wheel simulators out there. If you resently have been bumping around in the London underground, this is the shit to take you back.

I lack more missions with happenings like, huge crowds, breakdowns and what not... and after a few runs I really lack more lines. Hope to see that in a DLC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325918372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 915, 'last_played': 1520974333}
review:
I am really into games where you role-play as some sort of working schlub, and this game does not disappoint.  I have to admit that I have always been a train buff, and when I was a kid I used to be allowed to drive the tube train between Epping Ongar (those were the days – you will never be allowed to do that now).  I remember once being the London Transport Museum in London, and hogging the train simulator which consisted of a laserdisc controlled with authentic tube train controls rather than the players remote-controller.  So this game has the potential to scratch this particular itch of mine.  So does it?

Yes it does is the answer.  If I have an hour free, I'll drive a train from Edgeware Road to Hammersmith watching as the passengers fall through the ceiling, land on the platform and board my train, just as I'm ready to shut the doors.  I'll get frustrated in a good way when I get stuck at a red light at Aldgate, and have to follow a slow district line train all the way to Edgeware Road knowing that scheduling has gone completely to pot.

Less entertaining though is the fact that even if I leave every station exactly on time, it still seems to tell me that I didn't teach a schedule.  It seems to randomly complain that I braked too hard.  It inconsistently whinges about the setting of the destination board.  So I seldom ever get above 83% approval.  So that could do with patching.

So this sounds pretty negative right?  Yes, but I would still recommend this game.  If you're 100% completion nut, the buggy rating system will get on your plums.  Luckily for me I'm really not that bothered – I could not give an airborne act of copulation if those wingey digital passengers went shooting down the carriage and brained themselves on an old ladies walking frame when I nearly overshot the station at Farringdon.  I just find the whole experience extremely relaxing.

I'm running a GTX 690, 16 GB and a Sandy Bridge Core I7, and I'm running the game on what passes for the ultra settings.  There does seem to be quite a bit of frame dropping, particularly in tunnels but it's not a dealbreaker.  I have not had any hard crashes or game breaking bugs.  Yes, when you walk off the platform you fall into the void and respawn and as I have said the passengers do some pretty spectacular acrobatics – including throwing themselves in front of a train.  So although you can walk about it's not the most polished aspect of the game – but to worry about that will be missing the point.

In summary, for me this game is great.  More please.  Preferably the Central Line.  With the long closed Epping – Ongar branch included.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024501029', 'num_games_owned': 714, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1569666297}
review: A bit confused by the "discussion" link coming to this page. Perhaps it's a Steam glitch. But here's a review anyway. Atmospherically, this is an awesome game. You can get off wherever you like and just walk around. You can get a tube anywhere (so long as it's on the circle line) and just ride. Or you can drive. Graphically, this is much better than Train Simulator. The tunnels are lit fantastically. My only concern is the longevity of the game. No mods, no extra "missions", so it's just a case of passing half an hour or so driving a train through a few stops. Also, the game-breaker (a bit like Train Simulator, but a lot worse) is that if you break the rules (TS, you pass through a red light, the game ends), if you speed here excessively, the game ends. Disappointing. Especially when you can see the next tube ahead, just a few yards, and the game is a bit boring, so you just want to crash, and you can't. I dunno. So much promise, but it's lacking in something. I have to "recommend", but I wish there was a button in the middle. A caveat. I'll say this. Bear in mind that gameplay is limited. You will get bored very quickly. And you will look at your list of Steam games and you'll think, "Meh, not sure I can be arsed to drive a few passengers from this stop to the next." Mods would improve this game no-end.
